pros: Excels at walking and casual use; Well-priced for its features; Anatomical toebox for exceptional toe splay; Adjustable strap system; Capable on dirt roads and light trails; Lighter than the HFS series; True zero-drop platform; Exceptional flexibility; Great traction; Breathable upper
cons: Slightly heavy for its size; Outsole durability could be better; Not the most comfortable
RR_verdict: For runners seeking a true minimalist experience, the Xero Shoes Speed Force II delivers impressively across key areas. It has a breathable upper, real zero-drop geometry, and exceptional flexibility for natural movement. During our testing, we loved how the anatomical fit felt snug yet unrestricted, offering a barefoot-like ride that feels great on both pavement and smooth dirt roads. While we think it’s slightly heavy for its size, we firmly believe it stands as one of the most versatile minimalist shoes on the market.
awards: Top 25% in Xero Shoes, Top 25% in barefoot running shoes
